name: Colson House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a lovely weekend at Colson House, based largely on the favourable reviews on this site.
reviews.title: Lovely guest house

likes.disliked: — A bit noisy at times but not too bad

reviews.text: It's situated in Kemp Town, which is a brilliant location, away from the madness of central Brighton but only a short walk away from it.
reviews.title: Ab Fab!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As everyone says, the owners Eamon and Mark are terrific. A warm welcome, help with parking permits, discussions about breakfast etc etc, basically everything you need to know.
reviews.title: Great stay at Colson House

reviews.text: We stayed in the Judy Garland room. Overall it was excellent. A few negative points: the mattress sagged a bit in the middle, the fridge was a nice touch but really noisy at night and didn't actually contain anything (a few complementary bottles of water would have been great), and there's only a shower not a bath in the small en-suite.
reviews.title: We loved it and will be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Happily we wanted peace and quiet, and as the road is fairly quiet, we slept very well. I think if you stayed in the rooms on the ground or first floor you would invariably be disturbed by the comings and goings of other guests; the doors and walls are quite thin.
reviews.title: We will be back!

likes.liked: — The owners Mark and Eamon, the cleanliness, and delicious vegetarian food available.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here 11th and 12th May 2007. My partner and I were travelling to Brighton for a romantic get away, which is what we had. We stayed in the Clark Gable room, which although not huge was large enough for us. The the whole room was spotlessly clean and shower room was big . The bed was huge and room nicely decorated.
reviews.title: Lovely B&B

likes.liked: — Location, Hosts, Clean and Attractive Room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a fridge with free water and milk which is a nice touch.
reviews.title: Good friendly B&B

likes.disliked: — Rooms a little small, but only to be expected in style of building.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Eamon is a perfect host, is very quick to help with queries and provide solutions, i forgot my hairdryer which he sorted in seconds, and he gave me a front door key so that i could collect our cases hours after checking out which was kind.
reviews.title: Good B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Friendly and Charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Can be a bit noisy in mornings as people leave/arrive. The heating didn't seem to click in until the early hours, so it got a bit chilly at night, but not cause enought to complain. Had we been staying more than 2 nights we would have needed more hanging space for our clothes.
reviews.title: Our 1st Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Colson House is a lovely B&B in a great location. Just away from too much noise from town, but only 5 mins from the centre. Room (John Wayne) was very small, but lovely and clean. Hosts are very friendly and make you feel right at home. More choice at breakfast would be nice. Overall a pleasant stay, which was not cheap, but this is a B&B and not a hotel and to rate it so highly in brighton is strange. Would stay again if was a bit cheaper.
reviews.title: Good B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and myself stayed here for 2 nights recently. We had stayed in Brighton many times before and thouht we would try a themed guest house. We stayed in the Humphrey Bogart room near the top of the house. The room was small but clean with 3 pictures of the man himself on the walls, so i suppose this makes it the Humphrey Bogart room?? If that is the idea of themed rooms i might well open a guest house myself!! A bit of a joke really when you are paying about £10-£15 more a night for a couple of pictures on the wall. The floor in the room also slopes to one side, as does the bed! Which made for an uncomfortable nights sleep when you wake up on the edge of a wooden sided bed. Under the sheets was a rubber mattress protector...practicle but not comfortable. On the second day our bed hadn't been re-made when we returned to the room and our towels had not been replaced either and for £79 a night we expected clean ones.
reviews.title: Good but not that Good!

reviews.text: On the plus side the room itself was clean and the hosts Eamon and Mark are great guys. The breakfast was also excellent, well cooked and fresh. Don't sit in the window to eat though unless you want to look out onto the front garden full of rubbish and dying plants etc.
reviews.title: Could it be as good again?

likes.disliked: — The walk to the conference centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is good and it was the first time we had stayed in the Kemp Town area its only a short 10 min stroll into the town. If you are looking for good places to eat then there are good places to eat nearby. Turn right out of the guest house and then right at the junction onto the main street you will find a Thai restaurant called Sawadee. Great food and great prices, very authentic. Opposite is a fish restaurant that has recently had the Gordon Ramsey treatment but it was still empty and very over priced. I wouldn't bother eating in the marina either as most places are chains such as Frankie and Bennys and Wetherspoons all to commercial and samey.
reviews.title: Average B+B

likes.liked: — It's not far from the gay clubs+Brighton Pier
likes.disliked: — The standard double room was too small.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall i wouldn't rate it as highly as others. I think maybe Eamon and Mark might have become a bit complacent regarding the little things that matter to the paying public. The idea of the guest house is good but if they are going to charge more than all the normal guest houses then they have to make the effort ie clean towels every day and cleaning up outside the place...it all sounds good on the website but i would say it is just average. If you dont value your hard earned wages or you have more money than sense then you can stay here and you will enjoy it. We didn't dislike it we just felt we could have got more for our money!
reviews.title: Loved Colson House

likes.disliked: — Can't think of anything I did'nt like.

reviews.text: Visiting a place on a restricted budget, and being there on business is never easy, especially when you are involved in a conference. Having to leave early, and return quite late, you need somewhere comfortable and relaxing to set you up for the next day.
reviews.title: All I want is a room somewhere far away from the cold night air....

description: Colson House is a beautiful regency building with eight ensuite double bedrooms, each one themed around a 20th Century movie icon... so you can choose from Audrey Hepburn, Bette Davis, James Dean and others. The Guest House is located close to the city's heart, so whether you are coming for business, conference, or pleasure, it's a great choice. All bars, restaurants, attractions and clubs are an easy walk.
